member.summary: Gets or sets the value that determines if the picker will use styles based on Windows Presentation Framework.
member.remarks: By default the picker will use Visual Studio style that works with Visual Studio themes. Set this to true if the host does not support Visual Studio style.

member.summary: Represents the options used to create an account picker that works with the identity service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.AccountPickerOptions2.AddProviderFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets the picker's custom filter to determine which account providers are allowed to show accounts and be visible in the add account picker dialog. The Guid will be the AccountProvider identifier guid. The object will be the account configuration. For AAD based accounts this will be an IAadConfiguration. This object may be null. True should be returned if the account provider should be available, False otherwise.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.AsyncServiceProvider.globalProvider
member.summary: The global async service provider. Note that this is not a ThreadStatic field. Once a non-empty async service provider has been created, it will act as the async provider for all other threads as it is free-threaded and thread-safe.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.AsyncServiceProvider.#ctor(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.COMAsyncServiceProvider.IAsyncServiceProvider)
member.summary: Creates a new AsyncServiceProvider chaining to the other ctor and providing 'true' for the 'defaultServices' parameter.
member.param: The underlying service provider to use to answer requests.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.AsyncServiceProvider.#ctor(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.COMAsyncServiceProvider.IAsyncServiceProvider,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new AsyncServiceProvider object and uses the given interface to resolve services. If defaultServices is true (the default used by the ctor that doesn't take a 'defaultServices' parameter) this service provider will respond to IObjectWithSite as a service. A query for IObjectWithSite will return this object. If false is passed in for defaultServices this service will not be provided and the service provider will be "transparent".
member.param: The underlying service provider to use to answer requests.
Indicates if this object will respond to queries for IObjectWithSite or not.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.AsyncServiceProvider.#ctor
member.devdoc: Private, default constructor used to create a dummy AsyncServiceProvider with no underlying services.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.AsyncServiceProvider.CreateFromSetSite(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.COMAsyncServiceProvider.IAsyncServiceProvider)
member.summary: Create a new AsyncServiceProvider for the given site. Should be called from an object that implements SetSite (IObjectWithSite or IVsPackage). Automatically sets the global async service provider if it hasn't already been set. This method is typically called from the SetSite method of a Visual Studio package. Note: By calling this method, the caller declares that it knows the global async service provider and that the AsyncServiceProvider instance returned may be used by other, unrelated components, accessed via the AsyncServiceProvider.GlobalProvider static property.
member.param: The global IAsyncServiceProvider service.

The properties set on the build.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.CodeContainerManagement.ICodeContainerProvider.AcquireCodeContainerAsync(System.IProgress{Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ServiceProgressData},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Acquires an online code container locally.
member.param: Reports download progress. If this value is null, no download progress will be reported.
A cancellation token to cancel the operation.
member.returns: A task the returns a code container that has been acquired locally. If the task is faulted, the exception will be recorded in the VS activity log.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.CodeContainerManagement.ICodeContainerProvider.AcquireCodeContainerAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.CodeContainerManagement.RemoteCodeContainer,System.IProgress{Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ServiceProgressData},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Acquires a previously known online code container locally.
An example of a previously known code container is for a given signed in user, a code container that was acquired on one device and available as an online code container on a second device and available for reacquisition.
member.param: The online code container to acquire.
Reports download progress. If this value is null, no download progress will be reported.
A cancellation token to cancel the operation.
member.returns: A task the returns a code container that has been acquired locally. If the task is faulted, the exception will be recorded in the VS activity log.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ISolutionTreeFilter
member.summary:
A filter that controls a collection of items that should be included in the filtered tree. When the IncludedItems are placed into a tree, these items and their ancestors will be included in the tree, and all other items will be excluded.
When the filter is no longer needed, the tree control will dispose the filter.

member.summary: Gets the set of items that are included by the filter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ISolutionTreeFilter.GetFilterDescendantsBehavior(System.Object)
member.summary: Decide whether to include descendents if none are exlicitly specified.
member.remarks: Default implementation includes for non-hierarchy items. For hierarchies, it excludes for folder and project nodes and includes for typical member files.
member.param: The item to decide for.
member.returns: Whether to exclude or include by default.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ISolutionTreeFilterProvider
member.summary: Factory used to create an ISolutionTreeFilter. ISolutionTreeFilter provides a way to provide a list of included items which should be placed into the tree.

member.summary: Determines whether or not this type of filter is supported when the given collection of items are at the root of the tree.
member.param: The current collection of root items in the tree.
member.returns: True if the filter is supported, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ISolutionTreeFilterProvider.CreateFilter(System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary: Creates a new filter for the given collection of root items.
member.param: The current collection of root items in the tree.
member.returns: An ISolutionTreeFilter instance that can be applied to the tree to control which items are included in the tree's filtered subset.

member.summary: Retrieves an async services but allows the caller to hint that exceptions may not have to be swallowed. It does not guarantee exceptions will be thrown however for failure cases.
member.param: Service to get.

When this parameter is true GetServiceAsync will swallow exceptions thrown during the GetServiceAsync call and return null. When this is false exceptions thrown during the get service call may be thrown out of the method. A setting of false does not guarantee exceptions will be thrown for all services failures, or all service types.
member.returns: A task representing the service retrieval whose result is the service, or null if the retrieval failed.

member.summary: Invoked by the idle manager when it's a good time to get your periodic maintenance task done.
member.param: A token that is canceled when the user begins interacting with the IDE again.
member.returns: A task that tracks the potentially asynchronous background operation.
member.exception: May be thrown when is canceled in order to be called again the next time the IDE is idle.
Any other exception thrown by an implementation gets logged to the VS Activity Log and posted as fault telemetry.

remarks.para: This method will be invoked on a background thread. Attempts to switch to the main thread with will be processed with background priority.
This method runs at most once per session (during a long idle period), or more than once when prior runs were canceled due to user activity.

member.summary: Provides information about managed types from which toolbox items could be created.
member.remarks: Implemented by packages and supplied from IToolboxItemDiscoveryFactory.CreateItemDiscovery. Packages deriving from Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Package supply this object via the discoveryType argument to ProvideToolboxItemDiscoveryAttribute. This object is only used in a secondary appdomain which is unloaded after assembly enumeration completes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.IToolboxItemDiscoveryWithContext.AdditionalAssemblyPaths
member.summary: Gets a collection of additional assembly paths to search for toolbox items.
member.remarks:
For each framework in the "frameworksToEnumerate" argument of the ProvideToolboxItemDiscovery attribute, the toolbox will enumerate all assemblies registered under AssemblyFoldersEx keys, and pass their types to GetItemInfo. However, if you want additional assemblies to show up in your list, you can supply their paths here. You can even omit the "frameworksToEnumerate" argument altogether to use only the assemblies returned from this property. You can return null or an empty enumerator if you don't need to provide any additional assemblies.
This method may be called on a background thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.IToolboxItemDiscoveryWithContext.GetItemInfo(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.IToolboxType,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ToolboxItemDiscoveryContext)
member.summary: Returns the IToolboxItemInfo corresponding to a given type.
member.returns: The info about this type, or null if the type is not a valid toolbox control type recognized by this provider.
member.remarks:
This method should inspect the type of the argument if it needs to provide different information depending on the source of the type (such as an extension SDK). See the IToolbox*Type interfaces that derive from IToolboxType.
This method may be called on a background thread.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.IVsProjectSecrets
member.summary: An interface implemented by a project system to store secrets that the application this project builds can access at runtime.

remarks.para: An implementation of this interface may be obtained by calling IVsProject.GetItemContext(VSConstants.VSITEMID_Root, out IServiceProvider sp) and querying the resulting IServiceProvider for the service that implements this interface. Multiple services that implement this interface may be defined, each representing a different persistent store of secrets (e.g. secrets.json, appsettings.json, Key Vault). This interface itself should not be proffered as a the service type/ID to avoid confusion between the different sources. If a particular storage system may apply to multiple files in the project, this service may be found by calling IVsProject.GetItemContext passing in the ITEMID for one of those represented files.
Implementations are expected to be free-threaded and thread-safe.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationMethod
member.summary: How should the assembly be registered/located.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationMethod.Default
member.summary: Default should only be used by tools.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationMethod.CodeBase
member.summary: The path to the assembly should be stored in the registry and used to locate the assembly at runtime.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationMethod.Assembly
member.summary: The assembly should be in the GAC or in PrivateAssemblies.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute
member.devdoc: This attribute is the basis for all other attributes that can be registered by RegPkg.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.TypeId
member.summary: Override the TypeID property in order to let the RegistrationAttribute derived classes to work with System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetAttributes(...). An attribute derived from this one will have to override this property only if it needs a better control on the instances that can be applied to a class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.Register(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.RegistrationContext)
member.devdoc:
Called to register this attribute with the given context. The context contains the location where the registration information should be placed. It also contains such as the type being registered, and path information.
This method is called both for registration and unregistration. The difference is that unregistering just uses a hive that reverses the changes applied to it.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.Unregister(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.RegistrationContext)
member.devdoc: Called to unregister this attribute with the given context. The context contains the location where the registration information should be removed. It also contains things such as the type being unregistered, and path information.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.Key
member.devdoc: Abstraction around a registry key. This may or may not actually point to a real registry key. It could point to a file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.Key.Close
member.devdoc: Called to close this key. Alternately, you may use the C# "using" syntax on keys, since they are IDisposable. Always close keys when you are done with them.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.Key.CreateSubkey(System.String)
member.devdoc: Creates a subkey of the given name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.Key.SetValue(System.String,System.Object)
member.devdoc: Sets the name to the given value. Pass an empty string or null into this to set the default value for a key.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.Key.System#IDisposable#Dispose
member.devdoc: Closes the key.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.RegistrationContext
member.devdoc: Abstraction around the registry itself.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.RegistrationContext.ComponentPath
member.devdoc: The path to the compnent that is being registered. You should always use this rather than the codebase of the component type, and you should never assume that this is a physical path on disk. It may be a token that identifies the path at install time. The "component" is the type that the registration attribute was found on.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.RegistrationContext.ComponentType
member.devdoc: The type of the component that is being registered.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.RegistrationContext.InprocServerPath
member.devdoc: The path to the COM object supplying the class factory.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.RegistrationContext.CodeBase
member.devdoc: The path to the object being registered (including filename).

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.RegistrationContext.RootFolder
member.devdoc: The path to the installation for the host application (e.g. Visual Studio "C:\Program Files\Microsoft Visual Studio {version}\").

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.RegistrationContext.RegistrationMethod
member.devdoc: Specify if the assembly should be located using CodeBase or Assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.RegistrationContext.Log
member.devdoc: Returns a text writer that can be used to log registration information. This should be a human readable (and ideally localized) bit of text that describes the current registration process.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.RegistrationContext.CreateKey(System.String)
member.devdoc: Creates a new key of the given name. The key is created at the appropriate registration point in the registry. Always close or dispose this key when finished with it.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.RegistrationContext.RemoveKey(System.String)
member.devdoc: Removes the key of the given name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.RegistrationContext.RemoveValue(System.String,System.String)
member.devdoc: Removes the value of the given name under the key of the given keyname.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.RegistrationContext.RemoveKeyIfEmpty(System.String)
member.devdoc: Removes the key of the given name if it has no child key and no value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.RegistrationContext.EscapePath(System.String)
member.devdoc: Escape the string if needed This is used by the implementation of the Register method on attributes so that paths be escaped when needed. The attribute itself does not know if we are writting to a .reg file or directly to the registry.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.RegistrationAttribute.GetPackageRegKeyPath(System.Guid)
member.devdoc: Returns the registry path (relative to this AppID's registry root) where the registration for the given package is located.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ServiceProvider
member.devdoc: This class acts as a bridge between Microsoft.VisualStudio.OLE.Interop.IServiceProvider and System.IServiceProvider. It implements System.IServiceProvider and takes as a constructor argument an instance of Microsoft.VisualStudio.OLE.Interop.IServiceProvider. It supports both GUID and type based lookups and also has debug code to assert for common native implementation pitfalls, like not implementing IUnknown on an object or requiring a specific IID along with a matching SID.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ServiceProvider.#ctor(Microsoft.VisualStudio.OLE.Interop.IServiceProvider)
member.devdoc: Creates a new ServiceProvider object and uses the given interface to resolve services.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ServiceProvider.#ctor(Microsoft.VisualStudio.OLE.Interop.IServiceProvider,System.Boolean)
member.devdoc: Creates a new ServiceProvider object and uses the given interface to resolve services. If defaultServices is true (the default) this service provider will respond to Microsoft.VisualStudio.OLE.Interop.IServiceProvider and IObjectWithSite as services. A query for Microsoft.VisualStudio.OLE.Interop.IServiceProvider will return the underlying COM service provider and a query for IObjectWithSite will return this object. If false is passed into defaultServices these two services will not be provided and the service provider will be "transparent".

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ServiceProvider.#ctor
member.devdoc: Private, default constructor used to create a dummy ServiceProvider with no underlying services.

member.devdoc: Retrieves the requested service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ServiceProvider.GetService(System.Type,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves the requested service.
member.param: The ID of the service to acquire.
true to save any exception information such that it isn't lost when converted to an HRESULT. Must be false when called off the main thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ServiceProvider.QueryService(System.Type,System.Object@)
member.summary: Gets type-based services from the unmanaged service provider.
member.param: The type of service to retrieve. The GUID of this type is used to obtain the service from the native service provider.
The requested service, or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the service could not be located.
member.returns: The HRESULT of the QueryService invocation on the native service provider.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ServiceProvider.GlobalProvider
member.devdoc: Get the global service provider for the calling thread. The global service provider is set by calling ServiceProvider.CreateFromSetSite. If ServiceProvider.CreateFromSetSite has not been called, an attempt is made to retrieve the a service provider from the OLE message filter. If no suitable service provider can be found on the calling thread, then a new, empty ServiceProvider is returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ServiceProvider.CreateFromSetSite(Microsoft.VisualStudio.OLE.Interop.IServiceProvider)
member.devdoc: Create a new ServiceProvider for the given site. Should be called from an object that implements SetSite (IObjectWithSite or IVsPackage). Automatically sets the global service provider if it hasn't already been set. This method is typically called from the SetSite method of a Visual Studio package. Note: By calling this method, the caller declares that it knows the global OLE service provider for the calling thread and that the ServiceProvider instance returned may be used by other, unrelated components, accessed via the ServiceProvider.GlobalProvider static property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.ColumnState.SortPriority
member.summary: Sort priority for the column.

remarks.para: A priority of 0 means the table is not sorted using this column.

If more than one column has a priority > 0, then the table sorted by chaining the columns together in priority order (e.g. if two rows are equal according to the column with a priority of 1, then the two rows are compared using the column with a priority of 2, etc.).

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.IDefaultColumnGroup
member.summary: An export to define a default group.

remarks.para:
This is a MEF export and should be annotated with the following attributes:
[Export(typeof(IDefaultColumnGroup))] [Name(nameof(ProjectAndDefinitionGroupingSet))] // Requied, name of the default group [Order(After = ...)] // Optional, specifies the default location of the grouping in the dropdown. [ManagerType(...)] // Optional, the names of the TableManagers that support this grouping. [DataSourceType(...)] // Optional, the names of the data source types that support this grouping. [DataSource(...)] // Optional, the names of the data sources that support this grouping. [GroupColumns(...)] // Required, the names of the columns in the grouping.

Groupings are only displayed if the ManagerType, DataSourceType & DataSource constraints are all satisfied. In addition, a grouping will not be displayed unless all GroupColumns are provided by at least one .
The definition of this interface is intentionally empty (all data is provided via the metadata).

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.IEntryBucket2.Split
member.summary: Split the bucket into an equivalent sequence of buckets.
member.returns: null if the buckets can not be split. Otherwise an enumeration of the equivalent buckets.

remarks.para: For example, a bucket that represents the file path "D:\test\project1\project1\resources" might be split into buckets for "D:", "test", "project1", "project1", "resources".
The buckets will be stiched back together (using as long as the bucket has only a single child.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.IEntryBucket2.Merge(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.IEntryBucket)
member.summary: Merge two buckets created by if possible.
member.param: The bucket with which to attempt the merge.
member.returns: null if the buckets cannot be merged. Otherwise return a bucket that is equivalent to the this and .

remarks.para: Suppose the contents of the table control form the following tree of buckets and errors (where all the buckets except for the root were created by :
remarks.code: Root "D:" "E:" "myproject" "unittest" "integrationtests" Error1 Error2 Error3 Error4 Error5
remarks.para: In this case, will attempt to merge buckets "D:" and "myproject." There will be no attempt to merge "E:" and its children (since it has more than one). If the merge of "D:" and "myproject" succeeds, the the resulting tree will look like:
remarks.code: Root "D:\myproject" Error1 Error2 "E:" "unittest" Error3 "integrationtests" Error4 Error5

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.ITableEntryHandle.PinSnapshot
member.summary: Pin the snapshot for this .
member.returns: The used to create this entry or null if it or its equivalent no longer exists.

remarks.para: All calls to should be matched by calls to .
This will return null (and have no effect) on handles created from s.
If the used to create this handle was directly added to the , then this method will return that snapshot (but have no effect otherwise).

If the used to create this handle is managed by an , then this method will return its cached snapshot if still exists or it will ask the factory to recreate it if it does not. The factory may not be able to recreate the snapshot and, in that case, this method will return null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.ITableEntryHandle.UnpinSnapshot
member.summary: Unpin the snapshot for this .

remarks.para: All calls to should be matched with an earlier call to .
This will have no effect on handles created from s or ones created from an that was directly added to an .
If the used to create this handle is managed by an , then this method will decrement is "pinned" count and, if that count goes to zero, release its cached snapshot.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.IWpfTableControl.ForceUpdateAsync
member.summary: Force the table control to begin an update (which may not happen immediately).
member.returns: The version number of the pending update.

remarks.para: There should be no need to call this method (updates will happen automatically if there is a change). It is exposed here primarily to simplify testing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.IWpfTableControl2.IsDataStable
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the data in the control is stable.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.IWpfTableControl2.NavigationBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets the navigation behavior on a selected entry.
member.remarks: See for detail.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.IWpfTableControl2.KeepSelectionInView
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not to keep selected entry in the visible viewport after data update.

remarks.para: If this value is true, the first selected entry will always be kept in viewport after data update. Scrolling may happen in order to keep the selection in viewport.
if this value is false, the previouly selected entry may be out of viewport after data update and the control will not automatically scroll it back into viewport.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.IWpfTableControl2.ShowGroupingLine
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not to show a veritcal line next to entries when grouping is applied.

remarks.para: This value controls wheter a vertical line next to entries will be displayed if entries are grouped.
If there is no grouping in the table, this value does not have any effect. The vertical line does not show in this case.

member.name: E:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.IWpfTableControl2.DataStabilityChanged
member.summary: Raised when the data stability state was changed. Check for the new data stability state.

remarks.para: This event will always be raised on the thread that created the table control.

member.name: E:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.IWpfTableControl2.GroupingsChanged
member.summary: Raised when there is any grouping changed. This event is always raised on the thread that creatad the table control.
member.remarks: When this event is raised, you can get and then check (by casting to ) to determine what are the new groupings.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.IWpfTableControl2.RaiseDataUnstableChangeDelay
member.summary: Delay for raising event when data in the control becomes unstable.

remarks.para: Consumer can use this property to control the delay for raising the event when data in the control becomes unstable.
By default, there is no delay to raise such event. Setting this property to also disables the delay.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.StandardTableColumnDefinitions

They should not be used when calling ITableEntry.TryGetValue(...). Use StandardTableKeyNames for those.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.StandardTableColumnDefinitions.Line
member.summary: The column used to display the line number associated with the entry.

remarks.para: This column uses the key name in an entry.
The value displayed in the column is one more than the entry's value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.StandardTableColumnDefinitions.Column
member.summary: The column used to display the column number associated with the entry.

remarks.para: This column uses the key name in an entry.
The value displayed in the column is one more than the entry's value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.StandardTableColumnDefinitions.DocumentName
member.summary: The column used to display the document name associated with the entry.

remarks.para: This column uses the key name in an entry.
This column displays only the file name in the column.
The full path is displayed as a tool tip on the column (and is used when copying the column's contents).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.StandardTableColumnDefinitions.Text
member.summary: The column used to display the descriptive text associated with the entry.

remarks.para: This column uses the and key names in an entry.
If value exists then is displayed in the column and the full text is used as a tool tip and when copying the contents.
If value doesn't exist then is displayed in the column and when copying the contents and there is no tool tip.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.StandardTableColumnDefinitions.DetailsExpander
member.summary: The column used to display to indicate whether or not the entry has additional content associated with it.

remarks.para: This column uses the and key names in an entry.
This column displays as a in the table. The is the hyperlink's text and the is the tooltip displayed when hovering over the link.
Clicking on the hyperlink is equivalent to navigating to the entry's associated help information (see ).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.StandardTableKeyNames2.Definition
member.summary: Returns the definition associated with a symbol reference.

remarks.para: The expected return type is .

The returned should return values for the following keys:
StandardTableKeyNames.Text Text associated with the defintion. StandardTableKeyNames.DocumentName Full path of the document containing the definition. StandardTableKeyNames.Line Line (0-based) of the defintion. StandardTableKeyNames.Col Column (0-based) of the defintion.
StandardTableKeyNames2.TextInlines An enumeration of to display formated text as part of the symbol definition [optional]. StandardTableKeyNames2.DefinitionIcon An to display with the symbol definition's text {optional].

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.StandardTableKeyNames2.DefinitionIcon
member.summary: Returns an icon to display as part of the definition.

remarks.para: The expected return type is .

This is only used if the IFindAllReferencesSymbolDefinition.TryCreateColumnContent(out System.Windows.FrameworkElement) fails to return a . In that case the definition is displayed as icon followed by the definition text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableControl.StandardTableKeyNames2.ProjectNames
member.summary: Returns a list of name of projects that contain the error.

remarks.para: The expected return type is or null if the error belongs to a single project.
This property is used an error is created from shared projects (and, therefore, the same bit of code might generate errors in multiple projects).

The displayed path does not have to correspond to a valid location but should follow the standard conventions with respect to disk and directory separators.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableManager.ITableDataSink.IsStable
member.summary: Indicates whether the results reported to the sink are stable.

remarks.para: This property should be set to false whenever the source supplying the sink is likely to be posting changes frequently. It should be set to true when no changes are expected. For example, setting this to false at the start of a build and to true when the build has completed.

This flag has no effect of the behavior of the sink itself but the table control displaying data associated with the sink may display some type of "working" UI to indicate that the results are likely to change.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableManager.ITableEntriesSnapshot
member.summary: An abstraction for a fixed set of s.

remarks.para: A and its virtual entries must be immutable and callable from any thread. The one exception is that the snapshot's Dispose() method will be called when the snapshot is no longer being used (at which point there should not be any calls to get data from the snapshot or its entries).

member.summary: Get the version number associated with the snapshot.

remarks.para: This property is only used by created by an and, in that case, the VersionNumbers must be different if the contents are different.
The VersionNumber should always be >= 0 with the exception that an empty snapshot's VersionNumber can (but does not have to) be -1.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableManager.ITableEntriesSnapshot.StartCaching
member.summary: Hint to the snapshot that there will be a lot of access to the snapshot's data.

remarks.para: The model for using and releasing entries from snapshots works as follows. For snapshots that were directly added to an :
is called from a background thread at the start of an update pass and before any calls to .
will be called from a background thread at the end of an update pass.
will be called at the end of an update pass if either the snapshot had previously been removed or if the snapshot was a snapshot managed by an and none of its entries are visible in table.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableManager.ITableEntriesSnapshot.StopCaching
member.summary: Hint to the snapshot that the snapshot's entries will no longer be accessed.

member.summary: Can the data associated with the specified column be set?.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.TableManager.ITableEntry.Identity
member.summary: Returns an object that uniquely identifies the entry.

remarks.para: Two entries are considered equivalent if their are equal using .

This property (and the related properties in are used to persist various attributes like selection state when an is replaced with a new . Entries that replace an existing entry will have their attributes set based on the attributes of the replaced entry.

When is called, every entry in the list of old entries is checked to see if it has state and there is a corresponding entry among the added entries. If there is, then the two entries are considered equivalent and the old entry's attributes are copied to the new entry.
When a replaces its snapshot with a new version, the entry state is transfered over exactly as if had been called on the factory's old and new snapshots.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ThreadHelper
member.summary: Provide a generic dispatcher helper ensure that a method is invoked on the Application's main thread. We use the current Application's Dispatcher for convenient identification of the main thread. Note that this means that the Application's instance must be initialized. Currently, the WindowManager initializes it. However, we don't use DispatcherOperation because they are not RPC friendly. For example, if the UI thread is in the middle of an RPC call, and we need to run code on the UI thread, then DispatcherOperations will not get through. This is because DispatcherOperations are initiated by posting a message to the UI thread and the UI thread needs to dispatch that message. If the UI thread is making an RPC call, these messages will not be removed from the queue. The standard OLE message filter processes only a limited set of messages from the queue and even the Visual Studio message filter ignores most others. By going through the UIThreadInvokerPrivate service, the operation becomes a COM call on the UI thread. This operation will be allowed through our message filter IF it is part of the same logical call - the message filter will see it as a "nested call" and may not reject it.

member.summary: Singleton instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ThreadHelper.GetInvocationWrapper
member.summary: Derived classes must implement the GetInvocationWrapper method to implement a a disposable object that will wrap the called method. This may be null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ThreadHelper.GetInvoker
member.summary: Returns the IVsInvokerPrivate service interface or null if the RPC call to obtain this interface was rejected and the call should be retried later.
member.remarks: The service interface is not cached intentionally as COM proxies will be recycled by Windows internally after 6 minutes. In addition to that, CLR has a bug currently where they will not invalidate RCW's after its underlying proxy is recycled, so an immediate requery of the service after setting it to null will end up returning the same invalid RCW. More details can be found in bug 154688, but recommendation from CLR team was to not cache this instance and instead it query it each time as a workaround.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ThreadHelper.CheckAccess
member.summary: Determines if the call is being made on the UI thread.
member.returns: true if the call is on the UI thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ThreadHelper.ThrowIfOnUIThread(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the call is being made on the UI thread and throws COMException(RPC_E_WRONG_THREAD) if it is.
member.param: Optional name of caller if a Debug Assert is desired if on the UI thread.
member.exception: Thrown with RPC_E_WRONG_THREAD when called on the main UI thread.
member.remarks: The exception thrown from this method is not expected to be caught and handled by anyone. It is meant to cause the caller to fail, and get their attention that they should not be invoking the throwing code on the UI thread. This is analogous to throwing when the caller simply did not understand the contract of the method they were calling.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ThreadHelper.ThrowIfNotOnUIThread(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the call is being made on the UI thread and throws COMException(RPC_E_WRONG_THREAD) if it is NOT.
member.param: Optional name of caller if a Debug Assert is desired if NOT on the UI thread.
member.exception: Thrown with RPC_E_WRONG_THREAD when called on any thread other than the main UI thread.
member.remarks: The exception thrown from this method is not expected to be caught and handled by anyone. It is meant to cause the caller to fail, and get their attention that they should be invoking the throwing code on the UI thread. This is analogous to throwing when the caller simply did not understand the contract of the method they were calling.

member.param: Exception to wrap.
member.returns: A new exception whose InnerException is .

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ThreadHelper.Invoke(System.Action)
member.summary: Call an action on the UI thread. If the caller is already on the UI thread then the call is made directly. Otherwise, the call is transferred onto the UI thread and this thread blocks until the call returns. If the UI thread throws an exception, that exception is transferred and rethrown on this thread.
member.param: The action to run.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ThreadHelper.Invoke``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Evaluate a function on the UI thread. If the caller is already on the UI thread then the call is made directly. Otherwise, the call is transferred onto the UI thread and this thread blocks until the call returns. If the UI thread throws an exception, that exception is transferred and rethrown on this thread.
member.typeparam: Type of the function evaluation result.
member.param: Function to evaluate on the UI thread.

member.summary: Schedule an action for execution on the UI thread asynchronously.
member.param: The action to run.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ThreadHelper.BeginInvoke(System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority,System.Action)
member.summary: Schedule an action for execution on the UI thread asynchronously.
member.param: The action to run.
Priority at which to run the action.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ThreadHelper.InvokeAsync(System.Action,System.Func{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Makes the RPC call to invoke the action like method but in background thread. Since it is on background thread it doesn't block till the RPC call is served. If the RPC call fails, it retries till the returns true. This method is also different from the which uses UI thread dispatcher and it may not be in a state to process the request immediately (i.e. it can be in a pumping wait).
member.param: Action to execute.
Function to execute if the RPC call is failed. This function can return true to stop retying. It can be null if the invoker should keep retrying.

member.summary: Makes the RPC call to invoke the action like method but in background thread. Since it is on background thread it doesn't block till the RPC call is served. If the RPC call fails, it retries till the returns true. This method is also different from the which uses UI thread dispatcher and it may not be in a state to process the request immediately (i.e. it can be in a pumping wait).
member.param: Action to execute.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.UIThreadReentrancyScope.ClearQueue
member.summary: Clears the pending requests queue and removes all operation that can be cleaned up. This is called at the point of scope termination to ensure we can GC actions that were not executed since those will likely to be executed at outside of the scope and there is no need to hold on to them until the next scope activation.

Note that execution is not guaranteed as the scope might clear before the action is executed in which case the action is ignored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.IToolboxItemDiscovery.AdditionalAssemblyPaths
member.summary: Gets a collection of additional assembly paths to search for toolbox items.
member.remarks:
For each framework in the "frameworksToEnumerate" argument of the ProvideToolboxItemDiscovery attribute, the toolbox will enumerate all assemblies registered under AssemblyFoldersEx keys, and pass their types to GetItemInfo. However, if you want additional assemblies to show up in your list, you can supply their paths here. You can even omit the "frameworksToEnumerate" argument altogether to use only the assemblies returned from this property. You can return null or an empty enumerator if you don't need to provide any additional assemblies.
This method may be called on a background thread.

member.summary: Gets the icon for the toolbox item, as a file path, byte array, Bitmap, or IntPtr.
member.remarks:
This value can be any of the following, in order of decreasing efficiency (i.e. you should prefer the lower-numbered options): 1. The path to an image file (as a string). 2. A byte array containing the bytes of an image file. 3. A System.Drawing.Bitmap object. 4. A win32 GDI bitmap handle (as an IntPtr). For the file path and byte array, all GDI+ file types are supported: BMP, GIF, JPG, PNG and TIFF.
This property may be accessed on a background thread.

member.summary: For background tasks, this will cause the task to run its own thread instead of thread pool.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskCreationOptions.AttachedToParent
member.summary: Creates the task as attached to the currently running task. The parent task will not be marked as completed until this task is completed as well.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskCreationOptions.CancelWithParent
member.summary: Cancels the task when its parent is canceled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskCreationOptions.NotCancelable
member.summary: Marks the task as not cancelable. Users will get exception if they try to cancel the task.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskContinuationOptions.LongRunning
member.summary: For background tasks, this will cause the task to run its own thread instead of thread pool.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskContinuationOptions.AttachedToParent
member.summary: Creates the task as attached to the currently running task. The parent task will not be marked as completed until this task is completed as well.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskContinuationOptions.ExecuteSynchronously
member.summary: This option is not supported by the VS task library and it will be ignored hence continuations will not be inlined.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskContinuationOptions.CancelWithParent
member.summary: Cancels the task when its parent is canceled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskContinuationOptions.IndependentlyCanceled
member.summary: Separates the continuation task's cancelation so that it can be canceled independently. So canceling the current task doesn't cancel the continuation task and it executes in the order it is scheduled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskContinuationOptions.NotCancelable
member.summary: Marks the task as not cancelable. Users will get exception if they try to cancel the task.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskWaitOptions.AbortOnTaskCancellation
member.summary: If this option is set wait will return immediately upon cancellation of the task without waiting for task to complete.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskRunContext
member.summary: Managed definition of __VSTASKRUNCONTEXT.
member.devremarks: Whenever adding to this enum with a UI thread context, please update VsTaskLibraryHelper.IsUIThreadContext(VsTaskRunContext).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskRunContext.BackgroundThread
member.summary: Runs the task on background thread pool with normal priority.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskRunContext.UIThreadSend
member.summary: Runs the task on UI thread using RPC callback to be executed as soon as possible. Note: This context may cause reentrancy.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskRunContext.UIThreadBackgroundPriority
member.summary: Runs the task on UI thread using background priority (i.e. below user input). Tasks are scheduled even while modal dialogs are open. Tasks are scheduled to occur when no user input is pending, plus a short delay. Appropriate for short tasks or slightly longer tasks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskRunContext.UIThreadIdlePriority
member.summary: Runs the task on UI thread when Visual Studio is idle. Tasks are not scheduled till most modal dialogs have been dismissed. Appropriate for very short running tasks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskRunContext.CurrentContext
member.summary: Runs the task on the current context (ie UI thread or background thread).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskRunContext.BackgroundThreadLowIOPriority
member.summary: Runs the task on background thread pool and sets the background mode on the thread while the task is running. This is useful for IO heavy background tasks that are not time critical.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskRunContext.UIThreadNormalPriority
member.summary: Runs the task on UI thread using Dispatcher with Normal priority.

member.summary: Wraps the invocation of an async method such that it may execute asynchronously, but may potentially be synchronously completed (waited on) in the future.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskLibraryHelper.FileAndForget(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Threading.JoinableTask,System.String,System.String,System.Func{System.Exception,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Records error information when the given faults.
member.param: The task to track failures of.

An event name following data model schema to use when filing a fault event when faults. Must not be null or empty. It consists of 3 parts and must follows pattern [product]/[featureName]/[entityName]. FeatureName could be a one-level feature or feature hierarchy delimited by "/". For examples: vs/platform/opensolution; vs/platform/editor/lightbulb/fixerror.

A description to include in the fault telemetry event when faults. This value is not put in a bucket parameter, but it is in the ErrorInformation.txt file in the Cab file sent to Watson, and in the AI event.
An optional exception filter that must return true for the exception to be reported to the VS activity log and fault telemetry.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskLibraryHelper.FileAndForget(System.Threading.Tasks.Task,System.String,System.String,System.Func{System.Exception,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Records error information when the given faults.
member.param: The task to track failures of.

An event name following data model schema to use when filing a fault event when faults. Must not be null or empty. It consists of 3 parts and must follows pattern [product]/[featureName]/[entityName]. FeatureName could be a one-level feature or feature hierarchy delimited by "/". For examples, vs/platform/opensolution; vs/platform/editor/lightbulb/fixerror; This value is also provided as the source (first argument) to .

A description to include in the fault telemetry event when faults. This value is not put in a bucket parameter, but it is in the ErrorInformation.txt file in the Cab file sent to Watson, and in the AI event. If specified, this value is used as part of the message (second argument) to .
An optional exception filter that must return true for the exception to be reported to the VS activity log and fault telemetry.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ErrorHandler.CallWithCOMConvention(System.Func{System.Int32},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Use CallWithCOMConvention when an interop interface might be implimentd by managed code and it is expected to return HRESULT error codes but also throws exceptions. This method will catch all but critical exceptions and return the corresponding HRESULT for the caught exception.
Call as follows: hr = ErrorHandler.CallWithCOMConvention(delegate() { object.method(param); }); } or hr = ErrorHandler.CallWithCOMConvention(() => object.method(param)); }

member.param: The action to invoke.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TaskStatusCenter.TaskProgressCollectionStatus
member.summary: Represents the status of an .
member.remarks:
A collection starts with a status of . Once the first task in the collection begins to run, the status changes to . When every task in the collection has finished running (regardless of how it finished), the bit will be removed and the bit will be added to the status.
As tasks in the collection complete with a status of something other than , the and/or bits will be added to the status, as appropriate. A collection with a status of ( | | ) has at least one task that is still executing, at least one task that faulted, and at least one task that was canceled. When all the tasks in this collection have finished running, the collection's status will change to ( | | ). Individual entries in the collection can be inspected to determine which tasks ran to completion, which ones faulted, and which ones were canceled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TaskStatusCenter.TaskProgressCollectionStatus.WaitingToRun
member.summary: All of the tasks in the collection are waiting to run.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TaskStatusCenter.TaskProgressCollectionStatus.Running
member.summary: One or more tasks in the collection is running.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TaskStatusCenter.TaskProgressCollectionStatus.Completed
member.summary: All of the tasks in the collection completed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TaskStatusCenter.TaskProgressCollectionStatus.Faulted
member.summary: One or more tasks in the collection faulted. The collection can be inspected to determine which tasks faulted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TaskStatusCenter.TaskProgressCollectionStatus.Canceled
member.summary: One or more tasks in the collection was canceled. The collection can be inspected to determine which tasks were canceled.

member.summary: uint: Sets the DPI context in which the editor instance should be created. Valid values for this setting come from .

member.summary: uint: Sets the DPI context in which the editor instance should be created. Valid values for this setting come from .

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VsLanguageUserDataGuid
member.summary: These are optional IVsUserData properties that a Language Service may provide in order to influence the behavior of the Source Code (Text) Editor. The IVsUserData interface is retrieved by QueryInterface on the IVsLanguageInfo object of the Language Service implementation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VsTextBufferUserDataGuid
member.summary: These are IVsUserData properties that are supported by the TextBuffer (DocData) object of the Source Code (Text) Editor. The IVsUserData interface is retrieved by QueryInterface on the IVsTextLines object of the Text Editor.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VsTextBufferUserDataGuid.VsBufferMoniker_string
member.summary: string: Moniker of document loaded in the buffer. It will be the full path of file if the document is a file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VsTextBufferUserDataGuid.VsBufferMoniker_guid
member.summary: string: Moniker of document loaded in the TextBuffer. It will be the full path of file if the document is a file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VsTextBufferUserDataGuid.VsBufferIsDiskFile_string
member.summary: bool: true if buffer is a file on disk.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VsTextBufferUserDataGuid.VsBufferIsDiskFile_guid
member.summary: bool: true if buffer is a file on disk.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VsTextBufferUserDataGuid.VsBufferEncodingVSTFF_string
member.summary: uint: VS Text File Format (VSTFF) for buffer. codepage = bufferVSTFF & __VSTFF.VSTFF_CPMASK; vstffFlags = bufferVSTFF & __VSTFF.VSTFF_FLAGSMASK;.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VsTextBufferUserDataGuid.VsBufferEncodingVSTFF_guid
member.summary: uint: VS Text File Format (VSTFF) for buffer. codepage = bufferVSTFF & __VSTFF.VSTFF_CPMASK; vstffFlags = bufferVSTFF & __VSTFF.VSTFF_FLAGSMASK;.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VsTextBufferUserDataGuid.VsBufferEncodingPromptOnLoad_string
member.summary: uint: This should only be used by editor factories that want to specify a codepage on loading from the openwith dialog. This data is only for a set purpose. You cannot get the value of this back.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VsTextBufferUserDataGuid.VsBufferEncodingPromptOnLoad_guid
member.summary: uint: This should only be used by editor factories that want to specify a codepage on loading from the openwith dialog. This data is only for a set purpose. You cannot get the value of this back.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VsTextBufferUserDataGuid.VsBufferDetectCharSet_string
member.summary: bool: If true and the current BufferEncoding is CHARFMT_MBCS, the buffer will runs it's HTML charset tag detection code to determine a codepage to load and save the file. The detected codepage overrides any codepage set in CHARFMT_MBCS. This is forced on in the buffer's IPersistFileFormat::LoadDocData when it sees an HTML type of file, according to the extension mapping in "$RootKey$\Languages\File Extensions".

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VsTextBufferUserDataGuid.VsBufferDetectCharSet_guid
member.summary: bool: If true and the current BufferEncoding is CHARFMT_MBCS, the buffer will runs it's HTML charset tag detection code to determine a codepage to load and save the file. The detected codepage overrides any codepage set in CHARFMT_MBCS. This is forced on in the buffer's IPersistFileFormat::LoadDocData when it sees an HTML type of file, according to the extension mapping in "$RootKey$\Languages\File Extensions".

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VsTextBufferUserDataGuid.VsBufferDetectLangSID_string
member.summary: bool: (default = true) If true then a change to the buffer's moniker will cause the buffer to change the language service based on the file extension of the moniker.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VsTextBufferUserDataGuid.VsBufferDetectLangSID_guid
member.summary: bool: (default = true) If true then a change to the buffer's moniker will cause the buffer to change the language service based on the file extension of the moniker.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VsTextBufferUserDataGuid.PropertyBrowserSID_string
member.summary: string: This property will be used to set the SEID_PropertyBrowserSID element of the selection for text views. This is only used if you have a custom property browser. If this property is not set, the standard property browser will be associated with the view.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VsTextBufferUserDataGuid.PropertyBrowserSID_guid
member.summary: string: This property will be used to set the SEID_PropertyBrowserSID element of the selection for text views. This is only used if you have a custom property browser. If this property is not set, the standard property browser will be associated with the view.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VsTextBufferUserDataGuid.UserReadOnlyErrorString_string
member.summary: string: This property provides a specific error message for when the buffer originates the BUFFER_E_READONLY error. Set this string to be the (localized) text you want displayed to the user. Note that the buffer itself does not put up UI, but only calls IVsUIShell::SetErrorInfo. The caller can decide whether to show the message to the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VsTextBufferUserDataGuid.UserReadOnlyErrorString_guid
member.summary: string: This property provides a specific error message for when the buffer originates the BUFFER_E_READONLY error. Set this string to be the (localized) text you want displayed to the user. Note that the buffer itself does not put up UI, but only calls IVsUIShell::SetErrorInfo. The caller can decide whether to show the message to the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VsTextBufferUserDataGuid.BufferStorage_string
member.summary: object: This property is used to get access to the buffer's storage object. The returned pointer can be QI'd for IVsTextStorage and IVsPersistentTextImage. This is a get-only property. To set the storage, use the buffer's InitializeContentEx method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VsTextBufferUserDataGuid.BufferStorage_guid
member.summary: object: This property is used to get access to the buffer's storage object. The returned pointer can be QI'd for IVsTextStorage and IVsPersistentTextImage. This is a get-only property. To set the storage, use the buffer's InitializeContentEx method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VsTextBufferUserDataGuid.VsBufferExtraFiles_string
member.summary: object: Use this property if the file opened in the buffer is associated with list of extra files under source code control (SCC). Set this property with an implementation of IVsBufferExtraFiles in order to control how the buffer handles SCC operations. The IVsBufferExtraFiles object set will determine what files are checked out from Source Code Control (SCC) when edits are made to the buffer. This property controls the behavior of IVsTextManager2::AttemptToCheckOutBufferFromScc3 and GetBufferSccStatus3 as well as which files are passed by the buffer when it calls IVsQueryEditQuerySave2 methods.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VsTextBufferUserDataGuid.VsBufferExtraFiles_guid
member.summary: object: Use this property if the file opened in the buffer is associated with list of extra files under source code control (SCC). Set this property with an implementation of IVsBufferExtraFiles in order to control how the buffer handles SCC operations. The IVsBufferExtraFiles object set will determine what files are checked out from Source Code Control (SCC) when edits are made to the buffer. This property controls the behavior of IVsTextManager2::AttemptToCheckOutBufferFromScc3 and GetBufferSccStatus3 as well as which files are passed by the buffer when it calls IVsQueryEditQuerySave2 methods.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.UICONTEXT.FirstLaunchSetup_string
member.summary: Indicates that the first launch after setup is in progress. Packages may use ProvideAutoLoad with this UIContext in order to perform expensive one-time per-user initialization. Note that during FirstLaunchSetup many services are unavailable and a package may NOT display any UI. FirstLaunchSetup is not guaranteed to be called; it is just an opportunity for packages to build caches.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VS_E_PROMPTREQUIRED
member.summary: VS specific error HRESULT code returned when an attempt to do a save using RDTSAVEOPT_SileSave fails because source control requires a UI prompt in order to make the file to be saved editable.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VS_E_CIRCULARTASKDEPENDENCY
member.summary: VS specific error HRESULT code returned when an attempt to do a task wait operation would result in a deadlock due to circular dependency.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VS_S_PROJECT_SAFEREPAIRREQUIRED
member.summary: VS specific success HRESULT returned when a safe-repair is required. A safe-repair is one which is not a real full upgrade but merely a repair to make the project asset compatible without the risk of issues being encountered by the previous versions of the product.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VS_S_PROJECT_UNSAFEREPAIRREQUIRED
member.summary: VS specific success HRESULT returned when an unsafe-repair is required. An usafe-repair is one which is not a full upgrade, but with a risk of issues being encountered by the newer or previous version of the product. For example if a newer dependent SDK is not currently installed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VS_S_PROJECT_ONEWAYUPGRADEREQUIRED
member.summary: VS specific success HRESULT returned when a one-way upgrade is required. A one-way upgrade is a full upgrade which will make the project incompatible with the previous version of the product.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VS_S_INCOMPATIBLEPROJECT
member.summary: VS specific success HRESULT returned when a project is not supported by current edition of the product.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VS_E_BUSY
member.summary: VS specific error HRESULT returned by interfaces to asynchronous behavior when the object in question in already busy.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VS_E_SPECIFYING_OUTPUT_UNSUPPORTED
member.summary: Is returned by build interfaces that have parameters for specifying an array of IVsOutput's but the implementation can only apply the method to all outputs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.S_FALSE
member.summary: HRESULT for FALSE (not an error).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VSM_VIRTUALMEMORYLOW
member.summary: Message broadcast via IVsBroadcastMessageEvents::OnBroadcastMessage to indicate that the application is running low on available virtual memory. The wParam contains the available virtual memory in bytes. This message will be broadcast once per minute for as long as the low memory condition persists.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VSM_VIRTUALMEMORYCRITICAL
member.summary: Message broadcast via IVsBroadcastMessageEvents::OnBroadcastMessage to indicate that the application is running critically low on available virtual memory. The wParam contains the available virtual memory in bytes. This message will be broadcast once per minute for as long as the critical memory condition persists.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VSM_MEMORYHIGH
member.summary: Message broadcast via IVsBroadcastMessageEvents::OnBroadcastMessage to indicate that the application is using lots of memory The wParam contains the current pagefileusage in bytes. This message will be broadcast when memory usage degrades from OK to high.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VSM_MEMORYEXCESSIVE
member.summary: Message broadcast via IVsBroadcastMessageEvents::OnBroadcastMessage to indicate that the application is using an excessive amount of memory The wParam contains the pagefileusage in bytes. This message will be broadcast when memory usage degrades from OK/high to excessive.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.IBatchInitializationScopeProvider
member.summary:
Represents an extension point that can provide optimized behavior in a scope where many items are being initialized. For example, if many items are initialized as part of a transaction, but each individual item is unaware of the larger scope, this scope can be used to control that transaction while the initialization is happening.
IBatchInitializationScopeProviders are consumed by an implementation of IRelationshipService as part of its CreateBatchInitializationScope logic.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.IBrowsablePattern
member.summary: Represents an object that supports returning a browse object. Browse objects are used by UI like the Properties window to expose additional property information about an object. A browse object itself has no contract beyond IDispatch-style member discoverability.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.IBrowsablePattern.GetBrowseObject
member.summary: Gets the browse object associated with the browsable object.
member.returns: A browse object, or null if browsing isn't supported.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.IPrioritizedComparable
member.summary: Represents a comparable item that has a priority associated with it. Items with inequal priority will be ordered based solely on priority. Items with equal priority will be ordrered based on the results of the IComparable. This allows multiple classes of items which aren't comparable with each other (perhaps because they're unaware of each other's existence) to still be ordered deterministically.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.IPrioritizedComparable.Priority
member.summary: Gets the priority for this item. Items with equal priority will be compared based on the IComparable.CompareTo result. Items with inequal priority are compared solely by priority.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.IRefreshPattern
member.summary: Represents an item that supports manual refresh.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.IRefreshPattern.CancelLoad

member.name: P:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.IRelationshipSearchParameters.RelationshipHint
member.summary: Gets the relationship being shown in the view being searched. This can optionally be used by the ISearchProvider to provide optmized results, as only results that are reachable by following the RelationshipHint starting at the SourceItem hint must be provided.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.IResurrectableObject
member.summary: Represents an object which can be "resurrected" after expiration. This is primarily useful for objects which are destroyed and recreated as part of an operation like rename or unload. In such cases, these objects can notify observers of resurrection through the provided IResurrectionScope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.IResurrectableObject.BeginResurrectionTracking
member.summary: Called if the object should begin watching for and informing others of any potential resurrection.
member.returns: An object which tracks resurrection of this object. This scope should be disposed when resurrection tracking is no longer required.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.IResurrectableObject.IsResurrected
member.summary: Indicates whether the has object been resurrected. If the resurrectable object is disposable, this property is explicitly accessible even if the resurrectable object is disposed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.IResurrectableObject.ResurrectedObject
member.summary: The object that replaced the resurrectable object. If the resurrectable object is disposable, this property is explicitly accessible even if the resurrectable object is disposed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.IResurrectionScope
member.summary: An object which tracks resurrection of an object as a new object instance. See IResurrectableObject for more details.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.IResurrectionScope.Resurrected
member.summary: Raised when the original source object is replaced by a new object instance.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.ISearchProvider
member.summary: Represents one of potentially many search providers used for searching a PivotTreeView's content. The ISearchProvider implementation must be stateless or must guarantee that the Search method can be called simultaneously from multiple threads. GetDisplayItem will always be called from the UI thread to convert a result returned on the background thread into a display item to be viewed on the UI thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.ISearchProvider.Search(Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.IRelationshipSearchParameters,System.Action{Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.ISearchResult})
member.summary: Searches the domain understood by the search provider implementation.
member.param: Parameters for controlling the scope and result set; see the remarks for more details.
The action that should be invoked each time a result is realized.
member.remarks:
The search provider must return only results matching the SearchQuery provided in the search parameters. Search providers may optionally use the SourceItemHint and RelationshipHint properties of the search parameters to implement a more-efficient search. The search provider must return results that are reachable from the source item by following the hinted relationship; the provider may optionally return additional results that match the search terms but which are not reachable by this relationship, if the source item or the relationship are not understood by the provider.
Search must be thread-safe for simultaneous calls from multiple threads. As such, Search should only access properties and members of the SourceItemHint known to be thread-safe.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.ISearchResult
member.summary: Represents a search result realized on a worker thread. The search result should be able to be asked by the UI thread for the display item associated with the result.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.ISearchResult.GetDisplayItem
member.summary: Gets the display item that should be shown in the PivotTreeView corresponding to the result.
member.returns: The UI object that should be shown in the tree as a search result.
member.remarks: The data realized on the worker thread may not be showable directly in the UI. This result wrapper allows GetDisplayItem to be called on the UI thread to get the corresponding UI item for the domain-specific result gather on the worker thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.ISolutionAttachedCollectionService.TryGetFilterProvider(System.Guid,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Attempts to find an ISolutionTreeFilterProvider handled by the given command GUID/ID pair.
member.param: The command group to find the associated filter provider for.
The command ID to find the associated filter provider for.
member.returns: An ISolutionTreeFilterProvider that handles the given command, or null if there is no associated provider.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.ISolutionAttachedCollectionService.CreateBatchInitializationScope
member.summary:
Creates an object which can be wrapped around a task that may end up initializing many IAttachedCollectionSources. This can be used to optimize certain operations (like transactions) that may be more-efficiently performed if it's known that multiple source initializations will be occurring.
Extenders can export IBatchInitializationScopeProvider implementations, each of which will be called when such a scope is created. Multiple scopes created at the same time will only result in one call to the IBatchInitializationScopeProvider, and upon the releast of the last scope, individual scopes returned by IBatchInitializationScopeProvider will be freed.
member.returns: An object which should be disposed when the initialization is completed.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.UI.WindowsAndMessaging.MSG
member.summary: Contains message information from a thread's message queue.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

summary.para: Type: HWND A handle to the window whose window procedure receives the message. This member is NULL when the message is a thread message.
Type: UINT The message identifier. Applications can only use the low word; the high word is reserved by the system.
Type: WPARAM Additional information about the message. The exact meaning depends on the value of the message member.
Type: LPARAM Additional information about the message. The exact meaning depends on the value of the message member.
Type: DWORD The time at which the message was posted.
Type: POINT The cursor position, in screen coordinates, when the message was posted.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.PInvoke.SetParent(Windows.Win32.Foundation.HWND,Windows.Win32.Foundation.HWND)
member.summary: Changes the parent window of the specified child window.

param.name: hWndChild
param.para: Type: HWND A handle to the child window.

param.name: hWndNewParent
param.para: Type: HWND A handle to the new parent window. If this parameter is NULL, the desktop window becomes the new parent window. If this parameter is HWND_MESSAGE, the child window becomes a message-only window.

returns.para: Type: HWND If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the previous parent window. If the function fails, the return value is NULL. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.PInvoke.IsDialogMessageA(Windows.Win32.Foundation.HWND,Windows.Win32.UI.WindowsAndMessaging.MSG*)
member.summary: Determines whether a message is intended for the specified dialog box and, if it is, processes the message.

param.name: hDlg
param.para: Type: HWND A handle to the dialog box.

param.name: lpMsg
param.para: Type: LPMSG A pointer to an MSG structure that contains the message to be checked.

returns.para: Type: BOOL If the message has been processed, the return value is nonzero. If the message has not been processed, the return value is zero.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.
